attributes.additional_details:
Since vets were allowed to charge for prescriptions from November 2008, charges have continued to escalate. While it is only right that vets should make a charge for the time taken to prepare the prescription, many feel that the charge is totally disproportionate to the time involved.

I am therefore calling for a national cap to be introduced for veterinary prescriptions, to legally enforce an upper limit for such charges.

I am not going to propose the value of the cap, but perhaps it should be commensurate with the cost of a doctor's prescription in England.
